triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: The paper combines set-based reachability analysis as a core component of its novel motion planning approach for automated vehicles.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning is the primary problem domain being addressed, computing valid driving maneuvers for automated vehicles in traffic scenarios.

triples.name: Trajectory optimization
triples.relevance: The paper addresses trajectory planning as a specific instance of optimization, finding optimal driving maneuvers for automated vehicles.

triples.name: Convex optimization
triples.relevance: Convex optimization is combined with reachability analysis as the key mathematical technique for solving the motion planning problem.

triples.name: Self-driving car
triples.relevance: Automated vehicles are the application domain for which the motion planning approach is developed and validated.

triples.name: Benchmark (computing)
triples.relevance: The CommonRoad benchmark suite is used to demonstrate and validate the benefits of the proposed motion planning approach.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel motion planning method combining set-based reachability analysis with convex optimization for automated vehicles that maintains reduced computation time even in complex traffic scenarios.
